intro: Aylostera carmeniana, commonly known as the Carmeniana aylostera, is a rare flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are typically oval and covered in a fine, velvety texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Aylostera carmeniana is considered an endangered species.
